intro: Dunalia trianaei, commonly known as the Trianas' dunalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Dunalia trianaei is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
